place_description: Coffee Republic & Coworking – Huntersville is the best coffee shop near you for work and relaxation. Enjoy premium coffee, fresh pastries from our bakery, and a modern coworking space. Stay productive while savoring the best coffee in town!

reviews_data.review_text: I loved the Lavender Haze
Such a cute atmosphere, great coffee, and the customer service is excellent, esther went above and beyond!

My first time visiting here as a local on 3/25/25 at about 8:30am. I'm a coffee shop SNOB so strap yourself in, boss.

I'm not super impressed. Firstly, there's no direction anywhere near the store that tells you where to park. There's no parking nearby so if you're disabled, know that you'll have to walk about 100 feet to get here. There's a lot behind the shop but there's signs everywhere saying you'll be towed if you park there and then there's a lot 100ft to the left of the shop that you cannot enter from the main road.

I ordered a Nutty Latte and it was delicious so that's my one happy point. I asked for decaf and oat milk and this is an allergy situation so when I asked for oat and the barista didn't respond I had to ask her if she heard me. (This is annoying, it's common at most coffee shops to have your order repeated back to you, and when it's a potential allergy you should ALWAYS ensure the customer knows you heard them.) The baristas didn't look too thrilled to be there and when I walked in I received no greeting, they turned to look at me and turned back. (Someone else's review said this feels like a place where you're not welcome unless you're a regular and that's pretty much how I felt too, so I can validate that.)

Additionally, my spinach and feta danish tasted exactly like plastic. Like it's been stored in the fridge in a Tupperware for months and it just tasted like whatever it was stored in. You know, like fridge leftovers? Ew. 

I also did not find that this was a comfortable place to stay in so I sat in my car to eat. The chairs were metal and just the way the shop is set up it just doesn't look like it's designed for a comfortable coffee shop vibe. It LOOKS nice but it didn't look like there was anywhere for a solo person to sit comfortably.

Y'all need an upgrade in a few things. Imagine if when people walked in they received a warm greeting and your order was repeated back to ensure you're getting no what you asked for? (Even Starbucks does this come on!!) Imagine if instead of bar stools you had comfortable tables and chairs to sit at. Imagine if your baristas advertised your coworking space to anyone that may work from home? Or if you had a huge sign on the sidewalk that said where to park? Or if your pastries were fresh and stored in a case instead of in plastic in a fridge? So many ways to improve!
I'm not sure who hired these people, but they are not good at customer service; they weren't friendly. Their food is old, and never even warmed them up, their drink tasted like dirt.
Love this place!! Great coffee, great vibes!

Fun, clean, fresh and fun environment. Staff are super hospitable and welcoming.
Great space to come and enjoy a coffee and knock out some admin!
I'll be back!
Check this place out coffee shop vibes all day long
What an adorable little cafe!! The people there are so kind and welcoming.

Can't go wrong!
Great holiday varieties
Great early morning coffee/tea/internet/journal spot. Later in the morning is networking and community catch up for the locals. Great little spot and I will be back!

Came in this morning,lady behind the counter touched a customer's dog and then proceeded to go make my drink without washing her hands.And rolled her eyes after i asked for extra syrup so i decided to cancel my order very unsanitary won't be coming back.

I really want to like this place but I must complain about the coffee. I got the snickerdoodle themed latte which featured an asinine amount of cinnamon.  The coffee itself was good but I felt like glozell trying to finish this cinnamon lathered latte. Vibes here are good and the staff was kind. Will try another latte for sure.

I come for the people as much as I do the coffee.  Great staff and great coffee.  I start everyday with a Pepperment Patty Latte - thanks to the great staff for keeping the peppermint around for me even off season.  Ester, Emma, Sophie, Lexi,  Suzette,  Addie, and Cienna all do a great job!
My favorite coffee shop! Great drinks, friendly people, and immaculate vibes!
Great coffee and cool people

I enjoyed stopping by Coffee Republic in-between some things I had going on. I spent around 45 minutes inside. I tried their Dragon Breath energy drink they make, which I enjoyed a lot. It had a good caffeine ratio. If what they said was accurate, it was just over 300mg for their large. The thing I enjoyed the most, is although it's colorful it was not very sweet. It was just flavorful and easy to drink. I also tried a peanut butter bar which had a nice combination of chocolate flavor and the graininess of peanut butter. I got there just after 9. It was a tad crowded with only 2-4 spots open to sit. Thankfully they had that though. During the first 20 min they started to get a rush of take outs. Then within 30 min so a little after 9:30 it was pretty calm inside and a good amount of seating open. The staff was really friendly and patient as I tried to make a choice through all the options they had. I will definitely be back to try some other things out.

My first time here and I had the pleasure of meeting the sweetest barista; even. We ordered a little coffee, drank up, snd bought 2 more coffees. And the entire time asking him questions, and he obliged us on every one. Even coming by our table and offering conversation and he was so pleasant that my girlfriend made a bracelet on my behalf for him. We hope to see Even again : )

This place is amazing the vibe is really chill. Evan really helped us today with everything! He's so sweet and took care of everyone who walked in and even got water for the puppies who walked in. We even made him a bracelet because we felt so welcome and at home here even with this being my boyfriend's first time here. Thank you so very much for everything and being patient with our group! <3

Great survive and a solid line of house syrups. Really enjoyed the "Sugar Daddy".

This spot is kind of small and can get very busy on a Saturday.

It's always great to find a good local coffee shop over the large chains. Coffee Republic is a wonderful small shop with a variety of coffee drinks and a small food menu. Service was fast and pleasant. And the cappuccino was delicious!
Loved this place! Definitely a hidden gem!
Awesome place

I felt catfished by this place.  The food menu items and pictures in reviews were complete opposite in real life. Half of the food on the menu they didn't have or offer any longer. The minimal baked goods available looked a week old.  I ordered the snickerdoodle coffee - took my first sip and my teeth were covered in a disgusting cinnamon film! Same thing happened with the next couple sips. The coffee itself was so bland and lacked any flavor or sweetness that I could not even drink it.
My great grand likes this place and asks me to stop by if we are in the area so she can by coffee for her parents. I don't drink coffee and have never been in the place.
Excellent coffe prep: temperatue, flavor, appearance. Only thing missing is a coffee mug to drink from.
Cute little spot. Parking can be tricky.

Delicious coffee with cozy environment!
I loved going to this place and their coffee and matcha were quite delicious!

I definitely recommend giving them a try if you're in the area!
Friendly team members and the coffee is always good
If I could give this place a 6 out of 5 I would! Such a relaxed vibe and the owner is a wonderful young lady trying to balance 2 locations! So down to earth!!

The barista who helped me was kind! A lot of custom flavors here which could be overwhelming to some looking for more straightforward options but they were there, just ask. Got the Aztec mocha which tasted like heated chocolate milk. No notes of cayenne and little coffee so 4/5 in my book. Also used the coworking space which is $25 a day. Small yet multiple seats available to you if you go. WiFi is a bit slow when a lot of people are in so heads up

Ordered a cappuccino and received what tastes like hot milk without any espresso.

I should've known when she asked me what size drink for the cappuccino, but that all sizes come with two shots of espresso. A cappuccino is 1:2 espresso and milk, so that didn't make sense.
Way too slow. 7 people in front of me in line and it took 30 minutes to order. 1 barista and 1 cashier working at peak times.
Came to HFFA for a swim meet and got up Republic both morning for a cup of coffee. Don't drive to Starbucks, support a community place like this.  Fantastic hospitality and food!

Coffee is good but the staff  is so dry that makes the vibes in the place are off. Staff are not welcoming and give you impression that you came to the wrong place which make you don't want stay in the place. And finally the place is too small.
Way too expensive and the food and drinks don't taste good

Best service and coffee that I have ever had. What a wonderful team they have working for them. First, I was welcomed cheerfully at 7 am by a sweet girl , Lexi . And she gave me some great advice of a coffee to get. It was called a Sugar Daddy! Yummy yum yum . It was delicious. One of the best coffees I have ever had. Then , her coworker Phillip , came in and he was just as sweet and bright and cheery as well. What a wonderful place! And the rustic vibe is super cool . I will be back.
Great huntersville spot for coffee!

Update to prior review:
Coffee Republic is the same subpar coffee under a brand new banner. While not the most offensive coffee I've had, I personally find nothing great about any roast I've had from here. Maybe it's the location on Main St., but this is the most forgettable coffeeshop in Huntersville.

I have been drinking coffee for over 20 years, and this was one of the best coffees I've ever had. If you're in the area, please check them out. I like going more to small businesses than the conglomerates.
Chai tea is very good. Non-dairy milk available.  Completely lacking in vegan food options, despite 3 cases of food available.  Need some vegan options!

Coffee is good, staff is great, but those spinach and feta pastries blew my mind. I literally had a Homer Simpson moment while driving reminiscing about the pastry I just ate! Thank you! That was a real treat! I wish I lived in town - I'd be a regular!
They have the best coffee. It is super strong and always a good color.
Perfect little coffee shop. Very fast service when I visited for the first time. The danish was awesome and coffee even better. 10/10 will come here before another chain in the future.

The coffee is incredible and vibe is on point!  One of the best spots to meet with my real estate clients in Huntersville!  Great spot to sit and chat with clients, sip on a glass of wine with friends, or grind on client transaction paperwork.  Highly recommend you check them out - try the cold brew!
It's expensive like never in my life, never come back, super expensive ....insane

Stopped in for a quick pick me up since I was getting a tattoo just down the sidewalk and it was great! Barista was very nice and the coffee was good. The salty dog frappe was delicious. Only downside is that it was pretty pricey. No complaints other than that.

Why is it an extra $1.20 for an alternative milk? I get a small increase to make up for the fact that it's SLIGHTLY more expensive, but why are you profiting way EXTRA off the fact that I have an extremely common food intolerance? My god. Don't go somewhere this insanely overpriced and inconsiderate. This is more expensive than high end coffee shops in NYC and LA, and for what?

If you're just stopping in to for a drink, pastry, or food (they have some breakfast sandwiches and wraps) I would recommend it. However, if you're looking to find a comfortable place to work outside of your home, I would not recommend this place - the chairs on the main level are all metal with no back support or cushions (there is a sofa but also doesn't appear comfortable). I think this is meant to inspire you to purchase the $25 pass to use their upstairs area that is a comfortable work space that you see in the photos.

Just stopped by - coffee was cold, old and bitter.  Looks like they pumped out the dregs for me.  I feel like someone just stole $4 out of my wallet. Really wanted something nice after a hard day and hard week, and instead got the worst (and most expensive) coffee I've ever had. The cheap QuikTrip nonsense was better!
Very good coffee

I wanted to explore a local coffee shop and stumbled across this one on my maps. The decor of the coffee shop gave NYC vibe. I ordered the Sweet Pea drink on their spring menu, which is matcha latte with lavender and ube foam on top. It was delicious, more rich than Starbucks. It was $6-$7 depending on size. It's definitely worth a try to visit and I plan to come back!
The pastries were not fresh.

Coffee was okay as were staff. Unfortunately, I think the bagel was old. No taste and the texture of bread that been heated in the microwave even though it was toasted. Cream cheese didn't have much taste either.  Sorry to say I was disappointed. Someone else said nothing special. That is certainly correct.
Expensive coffee.
Iced matcha and chocolate croissant were decent. Nothing special and unique!!!
Ester is the best! Love having her make my coffee. Very sweet and nice - makes the coffee and atmosphere better!!
Love this spot!
I absolutely adore this gem  definitely recommend this spot it is cozy & warm and just love the vibes and the service...

I went here for a coffee date. The latte was made with LOVE! It was the most delicious cup of coffee I've had in a really long time outside of Carolina Coffee Roasters coffee I make at home! The customer service was attentive but not overbearing. I will be back!
Adorable local coffee shop, friendly employees, and coffee was excellent
Best espresso in Huntersville!
The food I got was awesome! Service was nice and everything else about was nice!
Very weak espresso based lattes, pastries not fresh. Otherwise chill but I wouldn't call it a work space. I tossed my drink and food. Would not recommend.
Lattes are so good

Fantastic coffee shop/pastry shop in Downtown Huntersville. Some things can be a bit pricey but I guess that's most things these days. I wish they would bring a large variety of French inspired pastries to the area. They had a great butter pecan bun though.

What the heck happened to main street?  This was our favorite place, all of them, but we went last weekend and it was not the same!  There was hardly any bakery and what they had was mediocre at best. I asked if they had been busy that morning and she said not really.

We got to going to a main street every time we went out because of the huge and delicious selection of delectable pastries, we'd buy more than we needed to try them all.  We got friendly with the bakers, Jess and Lex, they gave the place an energetic and happy vibe when they talked about their new creations.  It was fun and made Main Street special.  Plus we loved the idea that established owners let these young people try out new things and grow as culinary artists and managers.

Now all that is over and Main Street is just run of the mill, not special anymore.  We are back to rotating, and after our last blah trip, prob won't even keep Main Street in the line up.  Don't understand why you got rid of the one thing that made you stand out.  Those lemon danishes! The strawberry cream croissant!! The fun to see what they came up with this time. And the little egg bites to start off with some protein.  And now it's all gone, just same old same old.  

It's such a downer. Off to Waterbean.
great coffee and helpful staff. lots of seating as well. I love that they keep the menu fresh
Great customer service from the Barista's and I love the Snickerdoodle Latte!
Love it

Convenient location, Great looking shop and the  Coffee is ok.  I've ordered the espresso a handful of times hoping it would get stronger but their brew isn't for me.  Still give them a try you might like what they have to offer.

We stopped by on our way home, and this cute little coffee shop is adorable. There was only 1 girl working on a Saturday and she was killing it (9/9/23). I bought one of the kombuchas, the pecan pastry, and a cheese Danish. They were amazing! My sister received a latte and she enjoyed hers as well. Will absolutely stop by again!

Sofie is hands down one of the best baristas I've seen in any coffee shop. Friendly, fast, and remembers what I like. Honestly she's the reason I came back, and everyone else has been great too!

The atmosphere here is great, music is a nice level and good taste and they also have co-working spaces available with a kitchen. Great location as well if you ever need a stronger drink they're right next to a local bar.

I'm not a sweet coffee person, I usually like my coffee black but you guys have gotta try a Hot Snickerdoodle!
Always a great cup of coffee and baked goods.

Love this coffee shop! Pastries are scrumptious and the lavender frap is lovely. And you can taste the espresso, not just milk and sugar. My only complaint is that they are not close enough to where I live.
Love this place!
The coffee is really nice, plus it's a great place to just study or hangout.

The ideal location for a meeting!"" Main Street Coffee & Coworking is an ideal location for business meetings. The private conference rooms include everything you need, including a whiteboard and high-speed internet access. The coffee and pastries are a nice touch that help to create a relaxed and friendly environment for effective discussions.

Meh. I really hate when stores don't post their prices. I was quite shocked paying $4.02 for a 12oz drip. I understand inflation and supply chain issues. But, their local competitor is a bit cheaper and has more space for working or reading.

I really hope they pay a living wage at that rate!

A great place to connect with the community!"" In addition to being a coworking space and coffee shop, Main Street Coffee & Coworking serves as a hub for the local community. They host events, meetups, and workshops, providing an opportunity for people to connect and learn. It's a place where neighbors can come together and feel a sense of belonging.

Incredible coffee and service!"" Main Street Coffee & Coworking is a top-notch establishment that takes coffee seriously. The baristas are skilled and knowledgeable, brewing a perfect cup of coffee every time. The friendly staff goes above and beyond to ensure that guests feel comfortable and satisfied. It's a perfect place to refuel, both physically and mentally.
What a great place to get your concentration on.

A perfect blend of work and leisure!"" At Main Street Coffee & Coworking, you can work hard and play hard. The cozy seating areas, combined with the tasteful decor, create a relaxing environment ideal for productivity. They offer all the amenities of a traditional coworking space, along with the added bonus of a fantastic coffee shop. With delicious coffee and yummy snacks at your fingertips, work feels more like a treat than a chore.

Great coffee flavors and atmosphere. No prices listed on the menu at all then when you get to the register it's very expensive... the pastry I had was very very stale tasting as well, which is what i came here for. Lots of little snack and drink items for purchase.

A cozy coworking haven!"" Main Street Coffee & Coworking is a hidden gem for those looking for a comfortable space to work. The ambiance is warm and inviting, and the staff is friendly and accommodating. The coffee is top-notch, and the selection of snacks is perfect for a quick energy boost. This is an excellent place to focus and get work done!

I travel to NC for work and when I'm in the area of Huntersville i visit Main Street Coffee.  Great place, Great people and top notch service and delicious treats !   I highly recommend.   And if you need some quiet space for on the road work. They have that too!!!   Enjoy !

On so many occasions this place continues to have the worst service... it's takes 40 min to get a single drink. If you order on the app it's never ready either.
So sad it's such a cute place but I wouldn't be back unless service improves dramatically.
Not friendly staff.
Perfect hot chocolate and fabulous pastries
Best Dirty Chai in the area. I love the vibe inside this quaint coffee shop. I love that they serve breakfast and lunch. Come check them out!

I hate to give such a low rating, but I signed up for the coworking space and have been struggling for five months now to stop being charged once my 6 month commitment ended. I reached out to the owners and it took months to receive a response, and I'm still being charged for another 6month commitment that I didn't agree to. The lack of response and willingness to address the issue is deeply concerning. I've had to call my bank every month to dispute the charge. The baristas were always kind and the coffee was great. I just wouldn't sign up for the coworking agreement here.

Pretty okay coffee and latte. I like the vibe a lot in here but some more comfortable and plush furniture would be great. I will say the pastry was exceptional. The lemon danish had a delectable curd and I was so impressed! I definitely wasn't expecting excellence, but it's what I received. Cute atmosphere.
Had a couple of the latte specials, and my favorite was the Salty Dog! Nice staff, great coffee, decent price!

The ambiance is very cute, but the product is sub par. We ordered a caramel cold brew, an iced latte & a cheese danish which came to $18 before tip. The lid wouldn't stay on my cold brew which made for a messy ride home & I noticed the barista used caramel sauce, not caramel syrup, meaning all the caramel flavor was stuck to the bottom of my cup.

We weren't greeted when we walked in, even though there were only 2 other customers & they were already seated at a table.

Parking was frustrating as well as the parking lot in the back is for another business. We did a lap around the block before parking down the side of the street. With the cold rain we have today, this wasn't an idea walk.

We won't be revisiting with other, better options in the area.

1st visit just looking for our new local coffee shop. Lesson learned. Location is "cute" as the better half says. That's about the only positive.
Parking is not there. Overpriced & VERY VERY Poorly made drinks. Customer service is absolutely nonexistent. $22 spent on horrible drinks.
We literally debated going to another shop in Kannapolis on the way home. It's a shame that you feel almost forced locally to corporate coffee. The owner doesn't seem to care very much about local customer retention.
Amazing coffee that they roast!!! Always friendly staff
Fun new local place

Update: I am changing my review because the owner did try to make things right. I did give them another chance and it was a much better experience. This time service was quick and efficient and the coffee was delicious.
*
Went in for a quick coffee run. Waited 10 mins to order, 20 for my coffee that should have taken 10 seconds to make (just black hot coffee that you pour in the cup), said forget it and left.

I got the goldendoodle, I have never had a tumeric based drink so I don't have anything to compare it to. That being said, it is WAY to expensive... compared to other coffee shops. Save your money and go to a different place.

I'm an avid Chai drinker and this place has the best vanilla Chai latte that I've ever had. The Cafe is really cute and welcoming, too. Very hometown hipster kinda feel. The price is perfect as well. I know other reviews commented on the price hikes but maybe my drink wasnt part of that or they lowered the prices. Let's hope it stays that way bc this place is perfect
Nice place to chill and have a coffee or wine or beer

Shout out to the girl with purplish hair and the cool makeup for making my iced coffees. She's always super sweet and knows how to make my iced coffees- I'm picky about my sweetness.
Her and the crew there: 10/10
Definitely a great iced chai latte! Super cute atmosphere and friendly staff. I'll be back next time I'm in the area.

I didn't use the coworking space today, instead this was about two hours of coffee, laptop and watching people coming and going. Downstairs is a comfortable enough space with a sofa or two, several high top tables and a pretty massive Amazon pickup box that takes up a lot of space. I had a cortado (yummy) and used their wifi for a bit.

Great spot, great coffee. Street parking along Main Street could be a challenge on a busy day.
The ambiance was fabulous and my drink good, but a 16 oz. oat milk latte was $8.15 before tip!! I can't justify that price with so many cute coffee shops in the world.
So sad that the oversized cheese danishes are gone. :( Otherwise, excellent service and delicious coffee! :)

I visited this coffee shop for the first time last week traveling through town and was taken aback by the extreme high prices. The equipment they use to make coffee seems low quality for a personal setting, let alone a commercial one. To top it off, the coffee itself was so milky. I won't be returning after paying almost $10 for a latte. It's not just me, others have also expressed dissatisfaction with the unreasonable pricing. The owner appears to be trying to rip off customers.
Cool place with great coffee
Small town coffee shop feel. Always hopping. Attentive staff.

I love Main Street coffee and coworkers. It's such a friendly vibe and their coffee is great. I know inflation is crazy but I'm deducting a star for their pricing. I wish the prices allowed me to visit more regularly - I'm in the neighborhood - but today I paid $7.45 for an iced tea, and that seems absurdly high even with inflation!
We go to all three shops. Best coffee anywhere around north Charlotte!! Usually under staffed though. So you may have an extended wait. Especially at the Denver store.

My favorite place to get a latte (campfire mocha is my go to).  The entire staff is so pleasant.  Always takes the time to say hello and chat while they are working.  I come from the other side of Huntersville passing many coffee houses on the way just to go to Main Street Coffee.

Great service, decent food (although i just found the source 4 minutes away) but I'm not a fan of the drip coffee here.

I'm also frustrated by management not allowing anyone to use the upstairs area even on Saturdays when it's empty.  Downstairs you have hard metal chairs, metal stools or a awkward couch and since I've got leg issues and can't do that.   I've offered multiple times over the past 3 years to pay to sit upstairs for an hour or two and work but am told the only option is a day pass for $25....  Why?  Your rejecting my money and now your close to losing me and my near weekly visits all together.

This coffee shop and co-working space have it all! Every time I walk into this adorable space I am blown away by the coffee, the comfortability of the space, and the customer service (which is huge for me because I am a lifer in the service industry)!! Every person I have come in contact with who is about Main Street Coffee has been nothing short of amazing and welcoming. I am a part of their co-working space with a dedicated desk and the process of getting started has been seamless and easy, especially with the help from Leslie.
I always have a good experience at Mainstreet! I really enjoy their holiday latte and their Snickerdoodle one. Their pastries are great and so is their quiche :)
Great service, coffee, and beer here

I loved the trivia night! It is currently Thursdays 6:30-7:30. Very fun and relaxed with fun topics for each round. They serve wine, beer coffee, snacks and more for the evenings. Highly recommend for a fun laid back time.
Really good coffee in a really quaint and cozy location in Huntersville. Very friendly staff. Tasty baked goods as well.

The coffee here is good, but not worth the price. A regular lavender oat milk latte is $7.50. I've been to other coffee shops that locally source their beans in areas all over NC where rent more expensive. Those places managed to have just as good as coffee at a cheaper price point. This is coming from a former barista. The only positive is the good customer service.

Stellar coffee, but where did that bagel come from?

We went to the cafe and bought 2 bagels. Depending on which part we ate, the bagels were either hard as rocks or crumbly as crackers. The nice guys told us that they just came in, so it might be an issue with the supplier? We might come back because the baristas were so nice and the coffee was perfect.
Amazing places. Great vibes. Thanks to Phil who made me the best Chai Latte. Enjoyed my time here. :)
Love the space and the drinks I got were on point!

It's a cool place with good coffee and pastries but it's way overpriced. $12.00 for an iced coffee and an Apple fritter. I read one of the other reviews where they argue the price is valid. But my question is, why are you guys so expensive and Summit Coffee in Davidson isn't this expensive? I'm not sure that I can ever justify paying 150% of what I would pay at your competitor. Lower your prices and you will see that you'll do more business and in turn you will bring in more revenue.
Lovely staff, good service, good selections.  Yum!
Great staff, good selections, recommended!
Made my first Delivery here, very friendly staff and cozy vibe!
Worst customer service ever. It's so expensive here. $5 for a stale muffin and $8 for a flavor latte. When we asked why it's so expensive the girl just starred at us. Never coming back.
The staff are FANTASTIC!  Great atmosphere for me to get my work completed without the hassles of the regular office!
Great ambience, great customer service and great taste. Loved it!
Ordered drinks for my staff and they were a hit.  Everyone loved what they ordered and we will definitely be back.

This is a very cute cafe, really great lattes. The staff was kind and the atmosphere was modern but cozy. They had plenty of vegan/allergy free/etc. items. It's definitely on the pricier side and the bakery items were just okay, but definitely a nice place to stop for a special treat!

I just spent $8 on a 12oz vanilla lavender latte. Yes I substituted for almond milk, but that's still more expensive than Starbucks. I like to support local whenever possible, but it's tough when their prices are very pricey.

The customer service wasn't up to par either. No suggestions when I said I was hungry. I decided not to get anything to eat because they really didn't seem to care nor did they seem excited about me trying their coffee shop out for the first time. So, I opted out of the food! Which a muffin is $5. Lol I would've been persuaded if they suggested something they enjoy, however. Oh well. Their loss, not mine.

They didn't tell me to have a nice day either. So, I won't be coming back.

I LOVE this coffee shop!! They have the best employees who provide great customer service! The coffee is so delicious and pairs well with their bakery items. They never leave out the dogs either, so bring your pup for a treat!
Matthew was incredibly patient with me not knowing what I'd like and was super sweet with my dog. 10/10 perfect customer experience!

I go here all the time, and every single time I leave with a smile on my face. The girls working here make it feel like such an inviting atmosphere and I look forward to getting my coffee from them every day!

This place is deceiving. We signed up for 6 months of access to the upstairs coworking. Sean from the coworking side, is rude, condescending, and that is when you are able to get ahold of him!
This company has stolen from us. The coffee shop itself is great but who they are associated with are horrible.
We have now been charged close to $700 after we cancelled our contract.
They are now unavailable and refuse to respond. We have been dealing with this since April! We have tried to go through the proper channels and they refuse to even answer us.
Do not use the coworking aspect of this shop unless you want to get stolen from, and treated with disrespect.

Wish I could give zero stars
Been since april that our 6 month contract was up and they still charge us.  Tried calling, emailing, etc even talked to corporate and still nothing
One of my favorite coffee shops! My lattes are amazing here. I love that I can get a big cup too! Everyone is super nice. I went by this past Thursday and the guy was extra courteous.
Amazing coffee, friendly people, great cafe food selection and the quiche is out of this world

I was not as impressed as I thought I'd be, but I'm willing to try them again. The coffee I had was not really good. I had a cherry blossom in practice it sounded good it wasn't that good but that also could be because I think my almond milk was expired. I called to let them know that they should probably pour the milk out but the barista said that because their coffee is so acidic that it's just a "chemical reaction" that's why there were clumps in almond milk I've never had something like this happen. .  Not sure how true that was I feel like it was just an excuse I've been drinking coffee for a very long time and I've never had that problem unless the milk was expired.
Wonderful

I really do not know how this place got that many stars?
The coffee is bad, the execution is terrible and on top of that they are changing  the working hours the way is convenient for them.
The atmosphere is welcoming and cheerful, and the food and drinks are delicious.
Beautiful decor and excellent coffee!!

Very enjoyable experience! Staff is nice like Chick-fil-A but still open on Sundays. Even better if you need a chill quiet place to work, the coworking space upstairs is great. Also has a meeting room for the entrepreneurs looking to have a professional place to hold business. Would recommend to anyone in, near or even just passing through the Huntersville area. Top notch!

Lattes were delicious.  Very nice atmosphere.  The barista was very friendly.  The pastry selection was great, they all looked scrumptious.  Prices are average for a local coffee shop.  Beer and wine too!
A little less personal than before.
Good coffee, pleasant atmosphere. Amazon locker location.  Check out their co-working space too.
The latte wasn't hot-not even very warm and the pastry was a bit stale  I have had better experiences in the past though.
Absolutely loved this cafe!I wish there was one like it where I live.
I deliver to the Amazon locker in here, I tried their tuna quiche, although pricey, it was really good! I love the coffee shop atmosphere

One of my favorite coffee spots in town. Service is great, drinks are creative. That being said, theres a guy that has said hes the manager and he is inexcusably terrible. Was there on a weekend with a line out the door and hes in there maskless barking order at the baristats that his phone wasn't connecting to wifi. Clearly doesn;t treat his own staff with respect and he has made a nasty habbit of slamming doors in customers (who are holding coffee) faces. Wish my money could go straight to the workers who actually add value to the place, instead of that tool.

They are those few who got my order right. I am so impressed w this place. Please go here and buy coffee. It is one of those hide aways that no one knows about. Plus they have Boston creme doughnuts. I'm totally in love with place.
Favorite latte place, love their seasonal drink menu and occasional donuts

Just moved to Huntersville not long ago. This little shop is great. Amazing friendly staff, so many choices!!! Coffee was delightful I recommend the snickerdoodle. Lots of local artists sell goods and candles here. Really cozy feel.
Awesome fall flavors! Great muffins too!
Wonderful neighborhood coffee and snack spot with alcohol too. Very modern and well decorated.
I really do love this place.  The staff are nice and always helpful in choosing what drinks are their personal favorite.  I love coming here to read and study.

I love their lattes, but unsure how they can charge $1.30 for a splash of almond milk!? That's usually the price of a small coffee..I've been to coffee shops all over plaza midwood and Noda and the upcharge is usually .50 cents at most.

This may be the most expensive coffee shop in the Charlotte area.
Extremely slow. Took over 25 minutes for them to make me a cup of coffee. Very disappointed. Will not be returning.

Just bought a townhome down the road and was super excited to try this spot out. I work remote and the set up looks like a great spot to spend the day. When i got there, the barista informed me that it was $25/day to use the coworking space. Super bummed to hear that. Instead I ended up going downtown to work at Eight and Sand (and probably spending $35+).

The barista was super nice and the coffee was good. They also had a good drink menu. Wish I could of worked here and got the full experience. Great vibes downstairs it was just not ideal for working remote. The search continues...

I love it so much here! I try to come at least twice a week. The staff is always really nice and the coffee drinks are amazing. Pastries are also super delicious. The prices reflect the quality - it's worth it!
Cold Brew iced coffee was spectacular! Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The pastries and quiche looked excellent. And yes thats a chocolate chip cheese Danish in there...
My husband and I really love visiting this coffee place. Chai tea lattes are my choice when going to coffee places, and Main Street Coffee chai is one of my favorites.
A Huntersville gem!

Beautiful place to get a cup of coffee and hang out. They were busy but we didn't have to wait to long. Lots of options to pick from. They don't only carry coffee. They also have smoothies. We tried the Coco loco coffee, nana cabana and their chai latte!!! All the drinks were amazing. Im a big chai latte fan and not all places make it to my liking but this place made sure it would hit the spot. It has tables where you can work or do homework at. They also had items to buy that you could snack on.

Visited for the first time since moving here and I'm mad I haven't been before now!  Lots of amazing choices for coffee and I can't wait to go back to have a beer on the patio.  The barista was super nice and helpful.

I've visited Main Street Coffee and Coworking several times since moving to Huntersville last year. I love the atmosphere and the pastries and lattes are amazing. My favorite is the Salty Dog Iced Latte. It's SO good. The biggest downfall is that I don't live close enough to them!  I was working walking distance from my home, but would still make time to drive here several times to get a latte and sometimes a pastry before work. And... they're always open when they say they are! (Bad experience with another shop randomly being closed) Now that I'm working from home, I'll definitely be making a point to come much more often!
Fantastic coffee shop and coworking space in downtown Huntersville. Excellent service and relaxed atmosphere.
Overpriced. Female server "H" had the personality of a coffee stir stick.

The bagels and bakery items are quite good. The coffee is almost astonishingly bad. In 2021 people have pretty much figured out how to make coffee that is at worst decent, and this is the first place I have been to in many years which had coffee drinks that are just...bad.

The iced americano I ordered had about half the espresso you would expect it to have, it was very watery, and much weaker than hot brewed iced coffee is at most shops. The salted caramel latte was so astonishingly salty, and again suffered from too little espresso; it was basically a glass of salted milk.

Good spot for breakfast bakery and bagels, terrible spot for coffee.

We visited at 930AM on a Saturday. It is possible a new barista was on shift. Having worked in some cafes, it often happens that some baristas simply do not make drinks properly.

I will add, finally, that the prices are on probably the top 10% high end for coffee shops, very unjustifiably, in my experience.  The owners have offered some truly ludicrous reasonings for their prices in replies to other reviews, going so far as to claim they pay their employees a lot (a lot is apparently less than I made as a barista in 2014 in a low traffic cafe). I originally gave 2 stars as a charitable score and have since amended my review to 1 star.

So many great things to say about this little (but not so little) place! Delicious honey oat lattes, the snicker doodle latte is also yummy! Some of the best vegan banana bread I've ever had and nice staff .... but the best part about this coffee shop is the people you meet ( the other customers) thanks Main Street for making a great place for strangers to become friends!

We've been coming here since it first opened and we are so glad that it's thriving! We've tried their ice coffee, drip coffee, teas, fun lattes and their pastries. They are super gluten and dairy friendly, which I've always really appreciated. Many of their pastries are Dairy free, so you can find something for everyone (not to mention they are delicious!!!!). They just recently expanded to include mimosas, beer and wine too. Such a fun place to enjoy!
A great vibe inside, I would see as a good place to do some work. I ordered a cold brew and one of the big cheese danishes. Both were very good.
Nice place with nice people
good coffee and friendly staff the wifi is just a bit iffy and I would like it to be bigger

Not sure how a small chocolate latte with an extra shot of espresso and a cheese danish was $13.  I love supporting local businesses when I travel and the latte was delicious.  Just not happy with the price.

I had a chai tea latte, it was delicious. My husband is a pretty picky coffee drinker and he enjoyed their drip coffee black.

The Vegan chocolate chip banana bread was good and I enjoyed the laid back ambiance.

Partial owner kalea edwards is rude and condescending when behind the scenes. Just go and look at all the reviews she gives other places. Its like she gives other businesses the most petty false reviews to make hers look good. Her only positive review is of her own place....this place. If she's gonna provide false advertisement and reviews to up her place she should disable her account. Isn't this against the google review rules? I will be filing a complaint on her and her account. Go check for yourself.
First time here, and Chris did an amazing job! If your in the area I highly recommend you stop in.
Chris was awesome and so was the vanilla latte. Really cool hidden gem, and very efficient work space. We will definitely be back!
Rude and Unprofessional Staff

This is the best coffee shop in Huntersville. Got a GIANT blueberry muffin to which my barista warmed it up. Let me just say yum. Also, if you like Chai Lattes, must get one here. The atmosphere is awesome. Locals come in all day and the vibe is so happy and relaxed!
Finally stopped in and loved the holiday drinks! The hot chocolate bombs are beautiful and make great gifts.

Omg I love this place. I was originally looking for a co-working space that I could hunker down and get some work done for a couple of hours. I was able to come in take advantage of the day pass, use the conference room for a couple of important calls, and enjoy amazing coffee and a tranquil work environment. Margaret is the manager of the co-working space and is as nice as can be. This place is super accommodating and I highly recommend it if you are looking for a co-working space in the area or if you are just passing through.

Internet is 386MBPS!
Unfortunately this was one of the worst coffees I've ever had. For a $6 dollar coffee I was expecting excellent quality but this was below average. I wish I went to basic Starbucks
Came in here today.  Rachel waited on me, she was very nice, has a lot of knowledge on coffee and baking.  I enjoyed the lattes and the sticky bun.  Nice cozy atmosphere to the place.
Best Quiche in Huntersville, NC. Super relaxed environment with great coffee!
Cute little place! Love the pup cups for our dogs, coffee is great, and the staff is always so friendly
Love this place. The atmosphere and coffee is the best in town!
Pretty good
Great place to hold our small meeting. Nice atmosphere, friendly service, and wonderful coffee drinks!

Our team needed a space to meet off site for a meeting.  Margurite and the team at Main Street Coworking were fantastic to work with.  From ease of completing a request online to payment and everything in between.  Our group had a productive meeting.  We will definitely use Main Street again.  The cold brew was fantastic as well.

I ordered online through the app, Odeko. Fast service and great coffee. All the pastries and food we ordered were great, also. We took our coffee to go, but the inside looks cute, and we look forward to spending more time here in the future.
Does anyone know if the app Odeko takes part of the order money? Would it be better to call ahead with an order or just order when I arrive?

Everything about this place is amazing! They are s
careful about making dairy free options.
Amazing staff and yummy coffee

Great coffee, great muffins and a small sitting area to hang out in.  The workspace upstairs we didn't visit but did some work on the tables with the complimentary wifi which worked just fine for a quick meeting for 2.

Very charming cafe and co-working space! They always make my coffee just right (I'm very picky) and the quiche is always great. I used the co-working space for the 1st time and it was a great experience. Great design touches, you must see for yourself! Very easy to book a space and its super quiet.

The best customer service, hands down. I visited today with a few friends and we were at the back picnic tables during afternoon sun. The barista came out back with a pitcher of water for us to share since we'd all finished our drinks. Huge shout out to Main Street Coffee for your yummy drinks and kindness!

I love this coffee shop. I did want to talk about a really good experience I had with Ramona. She was incredibly friendly, professional and kind. We had never met before and she treated me like we knew each other our whole lives. She showed great customer service. I could tell she really enjoys her job. She's excellent!

Great coffee, excellent ambiance, friendly staff. Overall great coffee shop. So glad they are in the neighborhood. Support local businesses!!!

Iced vanilla latte was excellent as is the iced coffee. Lots of fresh bakery options too. Easy parking.
Cozy, quaint and great coffee.
Delicious excellent coffee within walking distance of the Discovery place.
Beautiful place. I loved the had vegan alternatives. Great music, amazing  design great to come with friends and hang out but a little to loud to sit and work . They do offer paid private spaces tho.
Nice place
Great little place to grab coffee and a bite to eat. They have vegan friendly offerings both with their drinks and snacks. The coffee is always great and the staff is very helpful.

Very cozy atmosphere and nice change of pace to bring in laptop and get work done in a place that has a good environment and positive vibes.  I just had a plain coffee, but I like they have organic flavored syrups, and pastries looked good.  Small space overall, but just adds to cozy feel.
Great coffee :)
Variety of coffee drinks & pastries with vegan options. Good local vibe with a range of sitting options. Had "The Nutty One" latte and it was a great choice! Friendly staff.

So let me set the scene, my son and I were driving about 2.6 hours to pick up a car he was buying, the evening is Christmas eve, as we were going up the interstate we just searched for a coffee shop and this one came up. This is one amazing place, the smell of coffee in the air, the greetings as we walked in the place, we ordered our hand crafted drinks and as the amazing lady handed me my drink I noticed some amazing bars that were peanut butter and oatmeal with a melted chocolate topping, let me tell you these were outstanding. Definantly plan to stop here again sometime. The Starbucks down the road has lame coffee compared to this amazing place.

I was traveling through Huntersville with a desire for coffee. At first I saw the hair was a Starbucks but then I noticed this neat little place, Google maps brought me straight to the coffee shop. As soon as I walked in I was greeted with a friendly face and a warm welcoming environment, The sweet smell of coffee and wonderful pastries was in the air. Placed my coffee order and it was fulfilled quickly. Coffee tasted amazing, they have found the perfect mix of coffee that is not too sweet nor to bitter. I am definitely going to make this a go-to location whenever I'm traveling through here
Awesome Lattes

I went to this coffee shop for the first time this weekend and I did not have a good experience. I live in Charlotte and this is 30 minutes out of my way, but I like to support new businesses and experience different coffee shops.

I ordered a large specialty latte along with another drink for my friend that was with me. The first thing that shocked me was the up charge for non-dairy milk.. $1.35 for almond or oat milk?? That is the highest I've ever seen and because of this I ordered my drink without non-dairy milk, even though I don't like to do this. The second thing was that they didn't ask for mine or my friends name when ordering the beverage. I watched as someone else took my drink when it was done, because it was just set up on the counter. The person that took my drink had ordered the same beverage, but a size smaller and with almond milk. A few moments later they set up this drink of the counter, when I went up and said it was not my drink, the employee said I could have that one. She did say if I didn't like it, I could get another beverage. I'm a generally passive person and even though I did explain that was not what I ordered, I took the drink and left. My friend also was not happy with her tea and stated it did not have a good taste. I am disappointed with this first experience and I'm writing this more to address that they need to ask for peoples names with they are ordering and think about lowering the cost of adding non-dairy milk.

All around the coffee shop was very cute and the staff was nice, also the coffee was delicious.
Cute place w lots of different options. The staff are pleasant. I try and come here at "least" once a week, if not twice.

Absolutely love this place! Perfect location and the coffee is amazing! I sometimes come here to work and it's great! Free WiFi, great environment! Plus ALL the baristas are fantastic, friendly and sooooo welcoming.
Great coffee, friendly staff. The owners seem like really nice people, too. My new favorite coffee spot.

To everyone planning on doing business with Main Street Coffee & Coworking, I am leaving a review of my experience while contracted to help get this business open and running.  I was initially contacted by the owner at the end of June this year, and was asked to build the frame to the coffee bar amongst other work.  During the first meeting my hourly rate was questioned. I was told the owner (a Licensed General Contractor) can get it done cheaper by his people.  After the first meeting I thought he had given the work to one of his people because it was almost a full month later before I would hear from him again.  I was also promised that there would be a plan for the Coffee Bar by the time I would get started, since during the first meeting there was NO plans drawn up, just blue painters tape on the floor.  In late July I was contacted to get started, which I did the following Monday. When I got there only the newly hired (hired 4 days before) General Manager was there, whom I worked closely with to design the coffee bar in the owners absence, because there were still NO plans besides the blue painters tape on the floor. After multiple change orders by the general manager, the owner, owners wife and the owners mother,  and making all the parties involved  happy with the final product, and after working for a total of 49 hours and purchasing material out of pocket, no payment and no explanation.  The owner has decided with NO explanation that he will not pay me my second and final invoice which included materials used on the job.  I do Not expect to see any of the final invoice, at the time of this writing the invoice is more than 90+ days overdue.  I only hope that anyone thinking of doing business with the owner reads this and know that if the owner is ok with doing this to 1 person, he is ok with doing it to 100 people.
Really enjoy visiting for a coffee date. Good coffee. Nice to have something in this part of Huntersville.

Went specifically to support a new local business. Wasn't in need of a coffee ...went to support. Two associates were helping a woman with her account. I was only person in line after her. Neither ever acknowledged me let alone took my order. After 5 minutes of being ignored I walked out. Again without a word from either. So much for local business hospitality.

Just What You Need and More from a Coworking Space and More

Probably one of the best new spots in Huntersville, Main Street Coffee and Coworking is a true gem and I'm thrilled that I found it.

I've been working from home for the past two years and needed a change. I don't have the same level of inspiration that I used to working in the same area, and I've just about overstayed my welcome in every Starbucks, Waterbean, and Barnes and Noble around.

What I absolutely love about this space:

--Comfy chairs: I know comfy office chairs are a must for any coworking space, the ones here are great. They are probably just your average office chair, but it feels 10x better than the one I have at home.

--Atmosphere: I needed a friendly space to switch back and forth between focus work and casual conversation.

--The Food: Downstairs from the coworking space is a state of the art coffee shop. The elderberry coffee is to die for (trust me, try it!) and the bakery selection puts just about everywhere else to shame. The only bad part is that I have to try to NOT come down multiple times a day for tasty treats.

What makes it a decent coworking space:

--WiFi is just what I need
--24/7 access
--Free drip coffee whenever I need it
--The price is just right (and for flex options, cheaper than anywhere else I looked).

If you are looking for a new space to hustle and get some good work done, need a new mainstay place to grab a coffee, or just want to join a cool group of people, stop by and sign up.
AMAZING coffee and a quaint comfy space. The Calm Bean is my favorite

I love this place! So happy to have such a quaint coffee shop in Huntersville. The coffee is delicious.  They have several food and beverage options for folks with dietary restrictions. And, even better, they have GREAT customer service.
This is a great spot to come enjoy a coffee with your spouce/ partner. Baked goods are excellent as well as the coffee. Will make this place our new coffee stop.

Wow! What an awesome little addition to downtown Huntersville! It has that family feel, warm service with a smile, and the coffee is ridiculously good! Not too mention the pastries and quiche. Definitely better than Starbucks!
Super cute , lovely idea. Everything looks fantastic and delicious. Just what we needed here
Best frozen coffee I've ever had, love the outdoor seating and is our new favorite Sunday afternoon spot. Nice quite place to read off the beaten path.
First time, very nice, coffee and extras where very nice as well, on the top end of the price scale
Very comfortable place for coffee and delicious pastries!

Great coffee, pastries and quiches. Very cool atmosphere. Quite a bit of seating out back, too. Meeting room for rent and rentable workspaces upstairs so you don't have to use up space for coffee customers.

Coffee gets 4 stars, everything else 1.  I know it's early but the wifi was maxed out with around 5 customers so the purpose for my visit (send emails) was impossible.  I had two flys fighting me the whole visit.  I'm sure they will sort out the kinks in the coming months. Would love to see this place succeed.
Robert was a great host and barista. Great local coffee shop with local baked goods. My new go to spot.

For those that miss Studio Coffee, make sure to stop by and enjoy what I consider to be the new and improved version. Becky and Ramie are back, and there's even more baked goods to enjoy! It's great to have a good, comfortable, and friendly coffee shop back in Huntersville! Welcome (back) to the neighborhood!
Nice facility.  Good expresso,. Coffee

Coffee... Delish... Pastry... Delish!!
AND they have a Banksy hanging on the wall!! Don't get any cooler than that!!
Great experience.

Stopped by this past weekend. Coffee was awesome along with the atmosphere and employees.  SO SO Happy that a coffee shop finally opened in this area. Much needed! Also a huge plus that it's walking distance from us especially since I work from home. Will be back frequently!!
Very cute space with large variety of coffee, tea and snacks!
Delicious coffee, lattes, and pastries!
Great atmosphere and wonderful coffee

Many Huntersville citizens have been anxiously watching for the opening of Main Street Coffee and Coworking. As former mayor, we have long-awaited the redevelopment of quality space in our downtown and it is clear that this addition will be a draw.
The coworking space is currently open and the coffee shop is nearing completion. The exposed brick and kitschy pictures and counters and little additions here and there immediately draw you in. The upstairs coworking space is just lovely and our Huntersville Chamber has seen an increased need for this type of offering.
I am personally thrilled to have Main Street Coffee and Coworking in our town and as the Executive Director of the Huntersville Chamber of Commerce and Visitor Center, I am confident that this will fill many needs for our citizens and visitors!
Welcome!
Love this idea having a coffee break while visiting discovery kids. But unfortunately the coffee shop is not open yet. The web page said it was open so that's why I am reviewing.
